title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{-7z}{{\left(-7z\right)}^5}=\frac{-7z^1}{{\left(-7z\right)}^5}=-7z^{1-5}=-7z^{\left(-4\right)}$$

title: Negative Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a and natural number $$n$$, the negative rule of exponents states that $$a -n=\frac{1}{a^n}$$
